title: Managing Graduate Education Complexity: Attenuation-Amplification Metaphor-Based Project Design (Self-Directed)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Mathematical Theory and Practical Application Experience
context.additional_context: An environment requiring personalized learning path design to help practitioners apply complex mathematical concepts to their work, conducted in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically categorize and prioritize complex mathematical problems using a damping-amplification metaphor.
Learners can develop and apply personalized learning strategies tailored to real-world problems through project-based tasks.

By the end of the mid-term course, learners can apply complexity management strategies of three or more levels (e.g., priority matrix, risk assessment, resource allocation) to a given project scenario and perform a comprehensive evaluation task (40-point scale) with a score of 30 or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
